page.title: 08BURNHAM-ON-SEA CARNIVAL.
page.content:
There have been carnivals in Somerset for over 300 years. They were held originally to celebrate the attempt by Guy Fawkes to blow up the Houses of Parliament.
Approximately 100 floats enter the competition which is held in November each year, some are musical and full of movement and some are tableaux, some are made by and for children, and there are majorettes and characters who simply walk along in costume. Everything is very brightly lit, and there is a wonderful excitement in the air at Carnival time.
There are several categories which are judged, and prizes are awarded for originality, overall appearance, costume and lighting.
